website_summaries.verdict: An adjustable culinary torch nozzle that fits easily onto any butane tank.
pros: Nozzle attaches directly to the fuel canister
Easy to turn on and off
Air and fuel adjustments for the exact level of flame that you need
cons: A few complaints about broken igniters

customer_reviews.title: There are many things that I like about the Iwatani torch
customer_reviews.text: There are many things that I like about the Iwatani torch, and the new stand is one. However, this model is even more cranky than the original one. I bought 5 torch heads and they are all difficult to light. One has to pull the ignition trigger many times, at least 10 or more, before they will light. It seems more cheaply made as well.
customer_reviews.author: emerald

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to find Iwatani butane in California
customer_reviews.text: The Iwatani torch did not fit on my old butane canister, and appears to require the Iwatani canister because of the way it fits on. California law prevents anyone (including Amazon) from shipping butane to a CA address. Online searches say that Walmart carries it, but our local Walmart does not. The torch itself may be just great, but it would be wise to ensure you have a reliable supply of fuel before making the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel G.

customer_reviews.title: Construction and reliability of product is good.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to sear meat after sous vide cooking but is not quite hot enough, or maybe the flame is not diffuse enough. Construction and reliability of product is good.
customer_reviews.author: C. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a day, came back the next and my full bottle was empty. It was leaking all night
customer_reviews.author: greg lupien

customer_reviews.title: Great for welding, or starting charcoal, maybe searing meat, but nothing delicate like a creme brulee.
customer_reviews.text: Decent enough torch, but the adjustment is a joke. It has one setting, which is FWOOOSH your stuff is on fire. Between 'off' and 1/3rd of a turn, the flame size varies wildly and can't be used, and anything past 1/3rd of a turn is full blast without any change no matter where the knob is. I have much better flame control on my propane torch, which even at full blast doesn't put out as big a flame as this thing does. My biggest regret is I bought a dozen cans of butane for the thing that I will probably never use, and nothing else I own takes them.
customer_reviews.author: DasGrinch

customer_reviews.title: Its okay.
customer_reviews.text: A lot larger then espected but seems to work okay I do if id recommend it
customer_reviews.author: I buy lots of stuff

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I hate this torch. The metal end actually catches fire and you get a double flame. It is starting to misshape and stays hot for 30 minutes after using making it a severe fire hazard. Shutting it off takes a whike after you have turned it all the way off as the flame has to burn out. Please dont buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kori

customer_reviews.title: When it works it's pretty good with tons of flexibility
customer_reviews.text: The self-igniter stopped working after a few days for no reasons. When it works it's pretty good with tons of flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Tam Thanh Pham

customer_reviews.title: Premium Blow torch. One of the best you can get among Amazon's selection!
customer_reviews.text: Great blow torch for cooking! I've been shopping around on Amazon for a while now on cooking blow torch and I ended up purchasing this one because one of the Japanese restaurant chef uses it. The plastic is made of high quality and there's an adjustment to the flame type so it is super useful. Their description advises to use their own Iwatani brand butane tank and I've been using generic third party brand I purchased from my nearby supermarket without any issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kazumichi Inagawa

customer_reviews.title: Very cool, but actually read instructions (they’re short)
customer_reviews.text: This works well. The design and execution are exceptional. One should read the instructions. This torch has a flow rate and a flame dispersion adjustment. I mis-judged the dispersion in the first lighting and could have lit several things on fire. The flame shot 3-4 feet. Everything has been fine since reading the manufacturers tips:)
customer_reviews.author: PickyGuy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This kitchen torch is super easy to use. It ignites reliably, and provides a good large flame. I'm using mine to sear meat after cooking sous vide. The char on the meat is pleasant, and the heat doesn't penetrate too deeply into the meat, so as to not increase the cook-temp of the meat. I've used it to finish pork chops, pork loin, various cuts of beef (including roasts) as well as salmon. Although it takes a few extra minutes to finish a large cut of meat - the end result is worth the patience. Best part - I can do this inside my kitchen and not smoke up the entire house, unlike when finishing steaks on a cast-iron skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Beth-Mij

customer_reviews.title: Best Torch I've Tried
customer_reviews.text: I love to make Creme Brulee and have tried several torches. Other's designed for the kitchen have performed poorly. The propane torch I use in the shop has been the best, but it keeps going out when I hold it pointing down. I saw this torch being used for Creme Brulee at a restaurant at Disney World and decided to buy one. It works great for that as well as in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: WallyD

customer_reviews.title: Great torch for the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I have previously been using a Benomatic propane torch in the kitchen for carmelizing duties for thing such as creme brûlée and searing . It works but it is a bit overkill and somewhat big and unwieldy. This butane torch works even better as the flame is wider and not as forceful. Using it with a butane can is much lighter and easier to handle. Great build quality also. You will not be disappointed with this in the kitchen. My Benzomatic goes back in the tool chest where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Geeman

customer_reviews.title: Second epic fail
customer_reviews.text: This is the last time I'm buying one of these- it's the second Iwatani torch to fail within ten uses.
customer_reviews.author: ChocolateMaven

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This was my second torch. The 1st one last about 5 years so I ordered again fromnthe same company, but this second one not only felt flimsier but lasted 3 months. It doesn't ignite so we have to light the torch with a lighter... kind of defeats the purpose though.
customer_reviews.author: S.EJ

customer_reviews.title: Faulty igniter after 1st use
customer_reviews.text: The igniter only worked for the first ignition then stoped working entirely. it looks great and is easy to use if you have a spare lighter to invite it with.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Mine flared up instead of shutting down.
customer_reviews.text: Torch worked for a few minutes then suddenly would not shut off properly. Instead of shutting off, it would flare up to full strength and it was impossible to shut off without completely dialing it down.
customer_reviews.author: ThereseTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for searing
customer_reviews.text: The torch produces a hot and large flame, perfect for searing. The controls allow for variability in flame size and strength so I can see it for using other purposes. The only thing to mention is that the butane canisters are little hard to get obtain unless you want to buy overpriced ones from Amazon. I recommend going to Asian supermarkets where they usually sell along with portable stoves.
customer_reviews.author: R. S**g

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a replacement for a Kitchen torch that did not work
customer_reviews.text: This one is so much better than the one it replaced there is no comparison. Attaches directly to fuel canister, easy to use, The torch is easy to use and the valve controls the size of the flame. Igniter works every time. Don’r Bother with the refillable models; this one much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Georgio55

customer_reviews.title: Fun kitchen tool that works w/ most standard butane fuel cans
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, I like what it does and is fun to use when I want Aburi sushi or want to sear my meats after sous vide. It can sometimes leave a taste of the propane gas on your food, but I also got the Searzall attachment that helps displace the heat and gas as advertised. Note: it attaches and works with the standard butane fuel cans, same ones used for portable camping stoves
customer_reviews.author: N.V.

customer_reviews.title: Easy!
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy when I received my blow torch and canisters because I love making crème brûlée and you just can’t get the same crispness to the sugar topping using the broil setting as you can with a blow torch but I had bought several inferior types of little kitchen handheld things and none of them worked and I have joint issues especially in my hands and I was over the moon at how easy this is to work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastice Torch
customer_reviews.text: The torch is very well made. Attaching the fuel can is very easy with no issues. The controls work flawlessly. The adjustment of the flame is very easy. The last time I bought the 8 ounce fuel cans at the "#1 Oriental Market" in Orlando FL they cost $1.49 each in a package of 4.
customer_reviews.author: Motivator

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the product is very functional and easy to operate and ignite. However, the burner pipe end shows the ugly heat zone discoloring and is an eyesore especially when left in the kitchen counter. I suggest the manufacturer shield the pipe with secondary ceramic or thermally coated pipe over the existing heat pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Totustuus

customer_reviews.title: High quality. Serious size flame. Fits standard butane canisters.
customer_reviews.text: High quality, ignites on one or two triggers. Serious size flame, which is adjustable. Fits standard butane canisters, so doesn't require Iwatani brand specific. Includes a base for the canister to reduce chances of tipping over, as it gets very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: Great torch head. Perfect for sous vide searing. I can find fuel for it in most hardware stores fo cheap. No need to purchase the Iwatani brand fuel. And I can't anyways because it is illegal for them to ship it to me in my state. Glad it was because I saved a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by imitations
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the real deal I've used a hardware propane torches for years; this thing is worth the investment. I also purchased a cheap one to see if it came close in performance not even close. This has a brass connection and smaller jets next to the igniter for instant ignition.
customer_reviews.author: IK

customer_reviews.title: Worth getting if you already use Iwatani fueled burners
customer_reviews.text: If you just want a good kitchen torch, get a MAP-fuel torch with a professional head (at most home improvement stores). But if you are already running Iwatani gear, having this torch head is a good secondary option for the fuel canisters. I wish it was built a bit more rugged overall, but the quality is decent.
customer_reviews.author: FILO

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great- Coleman refills at walmart
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Save some money and buy Coleman refills in the camping section for just a few dollars
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy very cheaply made not like the last one I had.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say this product is flimsy cheap it rattles and it doesn’t light very fast I have to click the button over and over again to get it to light. This to me is unsafe. It will be returned. The last one I had was made at a higher-quality. This one doesn’t even come close.
customer_reviews.author: Amy G

customer_reviews.title: Great Torch
customer_reviews.text: my husband loves this thing! he particularly bought it to torch his steaks. He loves how the steaks turn out after using the torch. reminds him of restaurant grilling. We've had no issues with it so far, just make sure you buy the butane fuel, it doesn't come with the can.
customer_reviews.author: Daniela M.

customer_reviews.title: Torch
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing!!! Just take it out of the box, pop it on a butane can twist the back and pull the trigger. It’s a very strong torch, you can cook sear steak with it or creat a hard brown layer for creme brulee!!! It’s a must have in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Duc C.

customer_reviews.title: Up your cooking game!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone claiming this adds a ‘bad’ or ‘off’ flavor is using this wrong, do not let blue flame contact food! Does exactly what it’s designed to do. I use this for sous vide steaks, pork, and to add a nice crust on corned beef. It also works great on pork shoulder skin! It puffs it up into crunchy goodness. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Stebner

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to find butane canister for this
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because it was highly rated. Returned it because we couldn't find the butane canister for it (instructions say you have to use the branded Iwitani butane canister, because it won't work with anything else).
customer_reviews.author: Bombgirl

customer_reviews.title: Be careful this may cause pyromania symptoms
customer_reviews.text: A local chef highly recommended this product. I've used it in my garage & enjoy it completely. Didn't try soldering copper pipe yet but have confidence it will do the job easily on 1/2" copper. Excellent for starting coals & finish with hair dryer or for quick drying some items.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice torch head for searing meats, and anything else you can think of. **You DO NOT need to use the BUTANE FUEL canister by Iwatani** The Coleman butane canisters sold at Walmart in the camping section, for $2.88 are the SAME EXACT ITEM. Overall this item feels solid, and seems to work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong flame
customer_reviews.text: Great flame, large enough to brulee custards quickly. Lights every time and seems well made. I like that it uses the same disposable fuel canisters as my stove.
customer_reviews.author: Michan

customer_reviews.title: Great Torch
customer_reviews.text: Great torch good quality. If your buying it to sear for Sous Vide then I would not get this. It's too small and takes for ever. I ended up using a Greenwood Propane Torch from Harbor Freight. This is much larger and quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It's Great!!
customer_reviews.text: We use this product to heat metal and it does a fantastic job and very quickly. You probably do not need more toarch than this!!
customer_reviews.author: KeyWestMike

customer_reviews.title: Good torch
customer_reviews.text: Good torch! I've used it three times so far, and all three times it has started up without any trouble, and stayed on throughout the torching of desserts and foie gras. Easy to use and easy to gradate the flame size for your liking.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fair

customer_reviews.title: The best professional torch
customer_reviews.text: This is the best torch I had used in a while. I bought a different brand and it had to refill the gas. But it always seems like the gas leaks out. So I saw this on Youtube and i like how you just need to attach the torch to the butane. I use it on everything now. i torched cheese and fish and chicken. One of the best purchases ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Xie

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I browned my slow cooled chicken with it. It looked and taked great! Didn't have to bother turning on the oven. I like that!
customer_reviews.author: Angelina Bambina

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: It holds fire on with out keep pressing it Been using it every day for more then half year. Still works great
customer_reviews.author: Garmand

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for foodies!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t grill anymore, which is sad. But I don’t have to because of this. I’m guilty of using it for everything from searing steak to melting cheese on grilled cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT whether you're a home cook and/or professional Chef
customer_reviews.text: SUPER solid build, easy to adjust, self lighting & loving the storage base provided. Iwatani never fails to surprise me - this product is the best torch I've used to date. just wrapped up torching 30 creme brûlées for a project last week
customer_reviews.author: Wesley O.

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: good quality, made in japan, easy to use, hook up to standard butane gas can
customer_reviews.author: barry pham

customer_reviews.title: Good value and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and safer than the kind that sometimes get stuck. This one is non slippery and does not flare too much when lit
customer_reviews.author: Gabbie

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Has been great for putting sears on sous vide foods, sometimes it adds a little gas taste but nothing awful.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Best torch
customer_reviews.text: This is a bit more expensive than other similar ones but it is really worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good butane torch.
customer_reviews.text: Works the way it should, does not flare up and melt like the one made by a different company that I had before. If you want a large head for butane, get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robin G. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Lot of actual metal is used thank god. However the main housing is plastic although seemingly an alright quality plastic. I wish it were metal. The actual torch is very easy to use and control. Extremely intuitive
customer_reviews.author: Na

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My son in law loves this torch to sear the steaks and light outdoor candles.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie B.

customer_reviews.title: Great torch for all types of cooking and whatever.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Very hot flame. Used to crisp salmon skin, chix and steak.
customer_reviews.author: WHIPPAH

customer_reviews.title: Makes fire
customer_reviews.text: Does the thing it claims. Finally comes w/ a stand thing for the butane bottle so it doesn't tip over all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Buhrkuhl

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful items
customer_reviews.text: My 4th one and I just love them. I can’t be without
customer_reviews.author: hjkass

customer_reviews.title: quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Looks and feels like quality product. Torch works as intended. It feels good and comfortable in hand and doesn't overheat like the other one I had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Burn Baby Burn
customer_reviews.text: Great torch works awesome, complete your kitchen with this little toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I have several torches but I like this one as it's easy to use and the stand works!
customer_reviews.author: Raylene Kinyon

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: It works good but I wish it would give me a little more heat
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable flame
customer_reviews.text: Use it to brown foods after sous vide cooking. Nice quick and easy flame.
customer_reviews.author: Covalent crema

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Hard to adjust the flame size, but otherwise it's pretty easy to use. Used it for creme brulee and to brown meat from my sous vide.
customer_reviews.author: Amos Hagege

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, easy instructions, have used this to make s’mores, creme brûlée, roast some peppers. Fast service too
customer_reviews.author: Maricris Trinidad

customer_reviews.title: Good flame control
customer_reviews.text: Easiest torch to use since it uses regular butane can instead to load it via zippo lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for Sous Vide
customer_reviews.text: This torch doesn't get hot enough to put a good sear on sous vide meat. Guess I'll have to upgrade to a propane torch.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Built well. Made in Japan. Costs more than other no-name clones but I trust this when fire and pressurized gas are involved.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Young

customer_reviews.title: Best Torch for the Money
customer_reviews.text: You cannot get a better kitchen torch for the money. Simple to use, reliable, and very hot. A great addition to the tasks one accomplishes own the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving image
customer_reviews.text: Your product image doesn't match what you deliver. You are deceiving. Where is my butane ?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Functioned well for ONE month. Ignition failed and also began spewing out random amounts of butane. VERY DISAPPOINTING for being manufactured in Japan as well as costing a premium.
customer_reviews.author: ryuki

customer_reviews.title: Great flame!
customer_reviews.text: Sous vide without this wouldn’t be the same. Easy to setup and use and quick to sear evenly.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Nice wide flame for better coverage as opposed ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it to get frozen product out of metal sheet pans. Works great! Nice wide flame for better coverage as opposed to the tiny butane flames you get out of the smaller ones.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Using it to cook some Wagu and for desert toppings it has worked great with no issues or leaks.
customer_reviews.author: M. Matchok

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I am not returning this item. At first you would not butane to California, so I purchased butane from Walmart. Do, I'm good. ty
customer_reviews.author: Cornelius R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and good control
customer_reviews.text: No issues. Good control of strength and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as previous
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exact model a few years ago. The lighting mechanism broke, so I bought another one. The new one is not nearly as strong of a flame as my previous one! Very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Lara H

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough for sous vide
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to sear meat for Sous Vide, but as others have said its just not strong enough.
customer_reviews.author: Damon H

customer_reviews.title: High quality and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality product and easy to use. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wilson

customer_reviews.title: X
customer_reviews.text: It’s very bad. I only use it for two days and I can’t light it. I have to light it with a lighter every time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: he

customer_reviews.title: Great Manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: This product has sincere craftmanship for buyers to use lengthy time.
customer_reviews.author: Sang

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to blister New Mexico Hatch chili peppers. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY T ZENKER

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.text: No real instructions that I saw. But works fine and is fairly self-explanatory.
customer_reviews.author: dmdurham

customer_reviews.title: Responsive, prompt seller.
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift so I cannot speak to the item’s performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My sushi tastes WHOLE LOT better with this!!! Awesome. Very easy and robust to use!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua P.

customer_reviews.title: Solid item for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love that it's easy to use. My only issue is that the valve for controlling the flame feels flimsy. It work great!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use for meat searing and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: zach trammel

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Gift- they reported they were very pleased with the gift. They have used it many times
customer_reviews.author: Louise T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and really helped me sear when using Sous Vide
customer_reviews.author: Nathan h.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Best one I've tried so far.
customer_reviews.author: Luciana M.

customer_reviews.title: The ideal torch for your kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: When using a Sous Vide cooking method, this torch is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Morgenthaler

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for some of my painting work. Very happy with it. The stand is really nice, gives it stability.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F

customer_reviews.title: i love it
customer_reviews.text: awesome toy to use for food, i can torch anything i see now
customer_reviews.author: Joseph estrada

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so cool! And very useful around the house, the torch is needed in every mans toolbox.

customer_reviews.title: It works great and I can use it with different brand of ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great and I can use it with different brand of butane can. It produces great flame and heat.
customer_reviews.author: KCC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it. You can get the fuel cans at Smart & Final stores if you have one near you.
customer_reviews.author: Marzy K.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life? So far, so good. No problems. Ignites.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lavender

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and you can control the flame well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and you can control the flame well. Is not the refillable type so it does take a separate fuel can,
customer_reviews.author: YMP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: First time using a culinary torch very easy to operate work awesome
customer_reviews.author: corvera67

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This torch is so easy to use. I even used it to light woods pellets on a smoker grill.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Comella

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Read the instructions before using it for the first time as it does contain useful tips on how to attach the can of fuel to the torch and certain other safety issues all of which are useful to keep in mind when using this or any other cooking torch.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I admit I thought the fuel was included, upon further review I discovered the slight extra payment was for the stand. Glad to have the stand. This is just as I hoped it would be. They might consider not showing the fuel in the second picture.
customer_reviews.author: KAB

customer_reviews.title: Great torch for any of your torching needs!!
customer_reviews.text: Prompt delivery. Fantastic torch! Be sure you understand that it is ok to use generic butane for this torch as long as it has the corresponding notch at the collar where the canister connects to the torch itself. Culinary butane canisters and camping butane canisters have the corresponding notches needed to work with this torch. Loving it now that we got the correct canister! 😀
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is much better!
customer_reviews.text: Was using a propane torch for sous vide; this is much better!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

product_meta.title: Iwatani International CB-TC-PRO 2 Iwatani PRO2 Culinary Butane Torch for sous vide, crème brulee, pastries, camping and so much more
product_meta.description: Size:1 PackWhether you're searing your perfectly cooked steak from your sous vide, creating the amazing sugary crust on your creme Brule, roasting and charring vegetables, or making scores for your kids the Iwatani Pro2 butane torch is perfect for you! It's fast and easy to use with adjustable flame size and shape to concentrate the perfect flame for your project. The one Touch Piezo ignition is designed for quick and easy start up. The safety plate ensures the Iwatani butane torch won't topple over wreaking have on your countertops or Floor. With the Easy to replace butane canister you can ensure you always have butane on hand without the muss and fuss of refilling - just twist and it locks in place. Super high power 6300BTU unit which gives you a much higher maximum temperature of 2700?/1500? When compared to competitors. Iwatani is devoted to top quality and backs it's Pro2 butane torch with a 1 year manufacturer . Made in Japan.
feature_bullets: Iwatani top quality butane torch is backed by a 1-year manufacturer (butane not included)
